meanings.definition: A mountain range in North Africa.
meanings.sent1: The djebels in North Africa are majestic and towering.
meanings.sent2: We hiked through the djebels to enjoy the breathtaking views.
meanings.sent3: The goats in the djebels must have the best view in town!
meanings.sent4: The djebels stood like ancient guardians, watching over the land.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the djebels painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A hill or mountain in the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: The villagers built their homes on the slopes of the djebels.
meanings.sent2: She loved to watch the sunrise from the top of the djebels.
meanings.sent3: The djebels looked like giant sleeping elephants in the distance.
meanings.sent4: The djebels seemed to whisper ancient stories to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The djebels loomed large against the horizon, casting shadows over the valley.

meanings.definition: The plural form of djebel, meaning a mountain or hill in Arabic-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The explorers marveled at the vastness of the djebels they encountered.
meanings.sent2: Local legends spoke of hidden treasures deep within the djebels.
meanings.sent3: The djebels seemed to play hide and seek with the clouds above.
meanings.sent4: The djebels stood proud and unyielding against the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The echo of their laughter bounced off the djebels, filling the valley with joy.
